content: fingerless gloves with mitten top emily dame-gibes fits child large-woman s medium hand size materials -approximately 310 yards of worsted weight wool -size g hook -size h hook -size i hook -2 small buttons of your choice -stitch marker or piece of contrasting yarn to mark beginning of rounds gauge i hook in mitten body pattern stitch 7 row and 7 stitches=2 fingerless gloves make 2 cuff foundation fc with h hook and worsted weight wool chain 13 row 1 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook and in each chain across chain 3 counts as 1st double_crochet now and throughout turn 11 double_crochet row 2 note all stitches from now on are worked in back loop only skip 1st double_crochet double_crochet in each double_crochet across and top of chain 3 chain 3 turn 11 double_crochet row 3 repeat row 2 until piece measures 6 5 do not fasten_off turn fold piece in half work following row through 2 pieces of fabric slip_stitch into fc and double_crochet row stitches 11 sl sts do not fasten_off turn cuff inside-out switch to i hook mitten body continue in i hook note mitten body is worked in spirals with no joining sts round 1 chain 2 counts as 1st single_crochet mark st as beginning of round with rs facing work 34 single_crochet evenly in cuff row ends 35 single_crochet total *continue to move marker up in succeeding rounds to mark beg of round* round 2 double_crochet in top of chain 2 space beginning of round *single_crochet in next single_crochet double_crochet in next single_crochet* around ending with double_crochet round 3 *single_crochet in next double_crochet double_crochet in next single_crochet* around round 4 *double_crochet in next single_crochet single_crochet in next double_crochet* around continue working rounds 3 & 4 until mitten body measures approximately 1 5 making sure to end with round 4 ending with double_crochet next round chain 2 don t forget to mark beg of round skip next 6 sts *single_crochet in next double_crochet double_crochet in next single_crochet* around ending with w/single_crochet thumb opening made 29 sts 2 chain 1 spaces next round 1 double_crochet 1sc in thumb opening *double_crochet in next single_crochet single_crochet in next double_crochet* around repeat rounds 3 & 4 of mitten body until total mitten body measures approximately 3 do not fasten_off switch to g hook round 1 single_crochet in next 6 st slip_stitch next st and st directly across from current st thus joining 2 fabrics single_crochet in next 3 sts slip_stitch next st and st across single_crochet in next 3 st slip_stitch next st and st across single_crochet in next 5 sts slip_stitch in next slip_stitch space single_crochet in next 3 sts slip_stitch in next slip_stitch space single_crochet in next 3 sts slip_stitch in next slip_stitch space single_crochet in last 2 sts *from now on each finger will be finished separately worked in spirals* finger 1 remove marker that previously marked beginning of round single_crochet in next 6 single_crochet skip next slip_stitch single_crochet in next 4 single_crochet on opposite side
